builder

Class NeighborGraphBuilder<S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • base.NeighborGraphBase<S,java.util.Set<S>>
      • builder.NeighborGraphBuilder<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - The vertex type on which the graph structure is defined.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>, NeighborGraph<S>

    public class NeighborGraphBuilder<S>
extends NeighborGraphBase<S,java.util.Set<S>>
implements ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>
    A basic implementation of the ModifiableNeighborGraph<S> interface, founded upon the NeighborGraphBase<S, Set<S>> class. This is a general purpose class for constructing NehighborGraphs.

    Note that by having the second type parameter of NeighborGraphBase set to Set<S>, the neighbor collections are then maintained as Sets. Accordingly, the getNeighborsOf(S s) method has been overridden to return a Set<S>.

    Author:
    pdokos

      • NeighborGraphBuilder

      • NeighborGraphBuilder

        public NeighborGraphBuilder(int numVerts,
                    int degree)
        Constructor for a NeighborGraphBuilder which has a known number of vertices and is of uniform vertex degree (i.e. a regular graph). By specifying numVerts and degree, this constructor preallocates the requisite memory for holding the graph.
        Parameters:
        numVerts - the designated number of vertices of the graph.
        degree - the designated valency of each vertex.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        an unmodifiable view of the of the Set<S> of neighbors of s.

      • addVertex

        public boolean addVertex(S s)
        Adds the object s to the vertex set of the graph, with an empty neighbor set. Subsequent calls to the containsVertex method of the NeighborGraph interface return true when evaluated on an object equivalent to s under the equals method of S.
        Specified by:
        addVertex in interface ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>
        Parameters:
        s - any object of type S.
        Returns:
        true if the graph does not already contain s, and s was successfully added to the vertex set of the graph.

      • join

        public boolean join(S src,
           S tgt)
        Joins the vertices src and tgt within the graph. These vertices are added to the vertex set of the graph if they are not already members. If the vertices were successfully joined, then subsequent calls to the method hasEdgeJoining(src, tgt) and hasEdgeJoining(tgt, src) return true.
        Specified by:
        join in interface ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>
        Parameters:
        src - any object of type S.
        tgt - any object of type S.
        Returns:
        true if src and tgt were successfully joined.

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Sets the state of building to finished. This cannot be undone, subsequent calls to addVertex and join return false and do not modify the graph. If the graph was specified as regular, or as having a certain number of vertices upon construction, then this method should only be called when these conditions are true.
        Specified by:
        finish in interface ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>
